The project focuses on enhancing capacity of government to monitor and forecast extreme weather and hydrology and promote use of hydro-meteorological information for making early warnings that inform long-term development plans.

title.narrative: Monitoring for Results and Results Reporting
Monitoring for Results and Results Reporting

description.narrative: The project focuses on enhancing capacity of government to monitor and forecast extreme weather and hydrology and promote use of hydro-meteorological information for making early warnings that inform long-term development plans.
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness

To strengthen the weather, climate and hydrological monitoring capabilities, early warning systems and available information for responding to extreme weather and planning adaptation to climate change in Malawi.

1. Capacity as per capacity assessment scorecard (Annex 12).
2. Domestic finance committed to DoDMA, DCCMS and DWR to monitor extreme weather and climate change.

comment.narrative:
1. Average CCA capacity scorecard rating of 72 across men and women (Annex 12).
2. Annual budget of USD allocated to DoDMA, DCCMS and DWR.

1. CCA capacity scorecard rating is increased to an average of 121 for both men and women (Annex 12).
2.20% increase in domestic financing committed to DoDMA, DCCMS and DWR to monitor extreme weather and climate change (including equipment operation and maintenance).

Considerable progress has been registered towards the attainment of objectives. Despite the fact that the actual implementation of the project started in 2014 with a lengthy procurement process, most of the hydrological and meteorological equipment has been purchased and delivered as well as installation in selected sites is on-going. Capacity building is also on track as a significant technical personnel from key institutions has received training thanks to the Department of Climate Change and Meteorological Services (DCCMS) and the Disaster Risk Management (DoDMA) who organised nine training courses ranging from 1 week to 24 months. A list of the afforded capacity building initiatives has been uploaded for referencing.
In relation to the set targets, the baseline and the two indicators, there was minimal quantifiable progress. This reporting period was mainly dedicated to preparatory activities.

description.narrative: The capacity of the Department of Climate Change and Meteorological Services (DCCMS) and Ministry of Irrigation, Agriculture and Water Development (MoIAWD) to monitor and forecast extreme weather and climate change enhanced.

1. Percentage of national coverage of climate monitoring network (fully operational).
2. Frequency and timeliness of climate-related data availability.

comment.narrative:
1. DCCMS – 15% national coverage of operational manual (15%) and automatic (0%) weather stations (Annex 6).
1. DWR – 52% national coverage of operational surface manual (85%) and automatic (19%) hydrological stations (Annex 6).
1. Number and type of operational stations:
Automatic weather stations: 6
Manual synoptic stations: 4
Manual river discharge and water level stations: 158
Rainfall logging stations actively transmitted through GPRS network: 0.
2. DCCMS:
i) 4 times daily between 5am-5pm for manual synoptic stations
ii) once a day for AWSs
iii) once a month for rainfall logging gauges.
2. DWR: daily to monthly basis.

1. DCCMS – 77% national coverage of operational manual (71%) and automatic (84%) weather stations (Annex 6).
1. DWR – 69% national coverage of operation surface manual (100%) and automatic (39%) hydrological stations (Annex 6).
1. Number and type of operational stations:
Automatic weather stations: 45
Manual synoptic stations: 22
Surface manual hydrological stations:
Manual river discharge and water level stations: 208
Rainfall logging stations actively transmitted through GPRS network: 53.
2. DCCMS: hourly for synoptic stations and daily for rainfall logging gauges.
2. DWR: 6 hourly and 2-4 hourly for flood prone areas.

There is considerable progress made towards the attainment of this outcome. The installation of the early warning infrastructure is underway as ten automated weather stations have been procured and installed in six out of seven districts (86% coverage of the project area which constitutes at least 9% of national coverage). Data from the AWS is being generated on an hourly basis. Hydrological equipment has been procured but not yet installed. Once installed, it is expected that it will contribute to at least 6% of national coverage. Modest progress has been registered that can be measured based on the indicators. During the reporting period in question the focus was on preparatory activities.

description.narrative: Hydro-meteorological and environmental information for early warnings and long-term development plans efficiently and effectively used.

1. Percentage of population with access to improved climate information and flood, drought and Mwera wind warnings (disaggregated by gender).
2. Policies, annual budgets and development plans that integrate climate information (type and level).

comment.narrative:
1. 10% of men and 10% women with access to improved climate information and flood, drought and Mwera wind warnings (to be confirmed during project inception).
Male: 628,620
Female: 663,136
2. Currently 0 policies and development plans.

1. 17% of men and 17% women with access to improved climate information and flood, drought and Mwera wind warnings (to be confirmed during project inception).
Male: 1,093,242
Female: 1,154,912
2. 7 District Development Plans and 1 National DRM Policy.

Access to early warning information was enabled through awareness creation exercises that were conducted at district level. 350 members of the Villages Civil Protection Committees (VCPC) received training on the benefits of early warning systems and the role that communities can play in disaster risk management.
The national disaster management frameworks have been enhanced: the National Disaster Management Policy has been approved by the Government of Malawi and dissemination at national level has been conducted. Preparations for district-level dissemination are underway.
